last_episode_to_air.name: Mark Phones It In
last_episode_to_air.overview: Bill Goldberg invades the Graveyard to strike a deal for a one-of-a-kind super car and he puts his daughter Allysa and his producer Aaron to the test with nothing more than a cell phone and his comedy.

name: Graveyard Carz
overview: Graveyard Carz is a reality television series that currently airs on Velocity. The show documents the select crew at Mark Worman's collision shop Welby's Car Care and their restoration, research and documentation of Chrysler vehicles. The restoration footage is bookended by Worman's musings and commentary, usually at his workers' expense. The crew also provides commentary on the projects, as well as about working with each other. Occasionally the owners of cars being restored visit the shop and tell their story. It is made on location at Worman's collision shop in Springfield, Oregon.

seasons.name: Season 7
seasons.overview: "Graveyard Carz" is a new genre of reality show. It fuses cars, characters, and comedy into a program unlike any other. "Graveyard Carz" is an automotive reality show focusing on restoring Chrysler muscle cars. Not only are the cars wrecked, they are beyond repair. To fix a Graveyard Car, it can't just be restored, it has to be resurrected.

seasons.name: Season 8
seasons.overview: Graveyard Carz is an American automotive reality TV show that restores late 1960s / early 1970s Mopar muscle cars

seasons.overview: "Graveyard Carz" is a new genre of reality show. It fuses cars, characters, and comedy into a program unlike any other. To fix a Graveyard Car, it can't just be restored, it has to be resurrected.

To fix a Graveyard Car, it can't just be restored, it has to be resurrected.

"Graveyard Carz" is an automotive reality show focusing on restoring Chrysler muscle cars. Not only are the cars wrecked, they are beyond repair. To fix a Graveyard Car, it can't just be restored, it has to be resurrected.

seasons.name: Season 13
seasons.overview: "Graveyard Carz" is a new genre of reality show. It fuses cars, characters, and comedy into a program unlike any other. "Graveyard Carz" is an automotive reality show focusing on restoring Chrysler muscle cars. Not only are the cars wrecked, they are beyond repair. To fix a Graveyard Car, it can't just be restored, it has to be resurrected.

episodes.name: Emma's Car
episodes.overview: The guys at Graveyard Carz are a crew of Mopar mechanics faced with the challenge of resurrecting some of the most wrecked muscle cars on the face of the earth.

episodes.name: It's the Great Pumpkin, Mark Worman!
episodes.overview: The crew at Graveyard Carz are excited about the pumpkin carving contest, but when an error leaves the Cuda filled with water, the whole crew has to pay the price.

episodes.name: Daren Goes Plum Crazy
episodes.overview: Daren's constant pestering and ribbing leads Mark to hand him the reigns of Graveyard Carz for a week. But instead of getting things done, Daren prepares for Christmas.

episodes.name: Runnin' Down a Dream
episodes.overview: After an angry call from the car's owner, Mark and crew have to buckle down and put the finishing touches on the 1970 roadrunner. Josh spurs the crew to choose new years resolutions.

episodes.name: More Than a Wrench
episodes.overview: Frustrated by the crew's complaints that he spends all day in the office not working, Mark is determined to prove to the guys that there is more to restoring a car than physical labor. Josh and Daren visit the crash site of the mangled orange 1971 'Cuda.

episodes.name: The Big Dipper
episodes.overview: As the team works to complete a multitude of cars, Mark stresses over the dipping of the very rare and valuable 71 Cuda four forty six barrel. Meanwhile, the 340 Magnum gets taken to the engine builder.

episodes.name: It's Alive!
episodes.overview: Mark examines differences between older and newer models of the Dodge Challenger in the second-season premiere.

episodes.name: Six-Pack to Go
episodes.overview: Mark and his crew fall behind on the '71 Charger project.

episodes.name: Hey, Charger!
episodes.overview: The '71 Charger is taken for a test-drive.

episodes.name: Wet Paint
episodes.overview: The Challenger receives a coat of paint; Josh stumbles across a surprise.

episodes.name: Factory Correct
episodes.overview: The guys add new equipment to the shop.

episodes.name: Holley Equipped
episodes.overview: Mark becomes concerned about the lack of research being done by his crew during restorations.

episodes.name: Every Rose Has Its Thorn
episodes.overview: Josh takes a part-time job, which upsets Mark.

episodes.name: You Win Some...
episodes.overview: The Barracuda returns from the sandblaster.

episodes.name: Cuda Madness
episodes.overview: The guys repair the Barracuda's fender.

episodes.name: Flippin' the Bird
episodes.overview: A surprise birthday party is planned for Mark.

episodes.name: Fish 'n' Chips
episodes.overview: Daren is left in charge of the shop.

episodes.name: Game Day
episodes.overview: Daren threatens to quit.

episodes.name: Phantasm 'Cuda
episodes.overview: The guys race to put the final touches on the black Phantasm 'Cuda before its owner arrives to pick it up.

episodes.name: Back in Triple Black
episodes.overview: Mark and the team rush to complete the triple-black, '71 Cuda, Phantasm homage car. The director and star of Phantasm, Don Coscarelli and Michael Baldwin, visit Graveyard Carz to check out the homage car and hopefully, drive it around town.

episodes.name: AAR You Ready for This
episodes.overview: The team tears down Mike Hill's '70 Superbird and finishes up final touches on Chris Driscoll's '70 AAR Cuda. Daren confronts Mark about stealing parts from his car and Mark gets a rematch on Chris Driscoll's race track.

episodes.name: Go for It!
episodes.overview: Holly asks Mark if she can work on cars. Mark Cain from Bad Boy Blasters brings the crew a huge gift. The '70 Barracuda is torn down and sent to the dipper, progress is made on the '70 Challenger and Mark gets a surprise from one of his favorite actors.

episodes.name: Get Your Hands Dirty
episodes.overview: Mark installs the hood decal on the '70 Challenger, Holly helps Josh disassemble the Barracuda suspension, Mark and Daren work on the 440 engine for the Challenger, and the team assembles one of the rarest Mopar options, the sunroof for the '70 Challenger

episodes.name: W-O-M-A-N, Mark Woman
episodes.overview: The team hurries to finish the '69 Dodge Daytona; a leadership dispute is settled in an old-fashioned manner; Daren strikes back when Mark won't allow him to sign for deliveries.

episodes.name: Pop Secrets
episodes.overview: Holly helps Mark with the 1970 Challenger; Daren causes Mark to damage a rare car; Tony D'Agostino visits; Daren reveals a secret.

episodes.name: Showtime!
episodes.overview: The '70 Hemi Charger is taken apart; the 1970 Sunroof Challenger is completed; Mark reveals his secret project to the team; Royal creates a video tribute.

episodes.name: The Royal Treatment
episodes.overview: The team builds out the 440 Super Commando engine for the 1970 Plymouth Superbird; the suspension is installed in the 1969 Dodge Charger Daytona; Mark's foolishness irks Daren.

episodes.name: The Grand Torino
episodes.overview: Body man Derrick becomes an official member of the crew; the 1967 Plymouth Hemi GTX convertible is disassembled.

episodes.name: The Waltons
episodes.overview: The team gets a large sheet-metal order for their '70 Plymouth Superbird; owners of a '72 Charger reveal what made their vehicle so special; Daren receives an offer for his '70 Challenger R/T.

episodes.name: It's the Great Pumpkin, Goldberg!
episodes.overview: Former professional wrestler Bill Goldberg arrives with his 1968 Plymouth GTX convertible.

episodes.name: Daytona Reborn, Part 1
episodes.overview: Part 1 of 2. The crew rush to complete work on a 1969 Daytona Charger.

episodes.name: Daytona Reborn, Part 2
episodes.overview: Conclusion. The crew rush to complete work on a 1969 Daytona Charger.

episodes.name: Drive a Mile in My Shoes
The Hills Have Eyes on a Superbird
Commando Cuda vs. Magnum Force
episodes.overview: Mark and Royal are back with a brand new shop and two old team members. The ghouls struggle to install the 383 in the 1970 Cuda and Mark checks in on the legendary Phantom Cuda at AMD.

episodes.name: Rallye Red Restored
episodes.overview: Mark paints the burnt orange Hemi Charger, AMD delivers the Phantom Cuda, and the ghouls race to finish the Dailey’s 1970 Cuda 383. A restoration that is four years in the making.

episodes.name: Hell Hath No '58 Fury
episodes.overview: The ghouls are wrapping up the 340 Cuda and installing panels on the Hemi Charger. Mark trains Allysa on O.E.M. assembly line markings and the team gets a visit from the legendary Christine.

episodes.name: 400 Magnum Misfire
episodes.overview: The team struggles with after-market parts on their 400 Magnum engine. Allyssa gets out of the office and into the shop...sort of. The ghouls disassemble two incredibly rare Mopars, including a convertible worth over 7 figures.

episodes.name: Return of the '70 Sunroof Challenger
episodes.overview: The film crew follows Mark for the day and witnesses his addiction. The 1970 Sunroof Challenger returns and its condition is shocking. The ghouls start work on the 1970, Plum Crazy, 440, 6 pack, Challenger.

episodes.name: '70 Cuda Grace
episodes.overview: The entire restoration of the 1970 'Cuda 340 is revealed. Watch Mark and the Ghouls battle with the 340 engine, as every possible problem is encountered, and find out if someone sabotaged the engine.

episodes.name: Hemi Orange is the New Corporate Blue
episodes.overview: The ghouls begin work on Bill Goldberg's '68 GTX, Mark repairs some bad body work on a Challenger decklid, and Will paints Brett Torino's '67 Hemi GTX. When Mark sets out to paint the 400 Magnum and Hemi engines, Will challenges him to a paint off.

episodes.name: Grand Theft Hemi
episodes.overview: Mark teaches Allysa to analyze and document cars in preparation for dis-assembly, but she later makes a crucial mistake. Also: the team install the 400 Magnum in the 1972 Dodge Charger.

episodes.name: Investigation O.E.
episodes.overview: Rare Mopars, a Daytona survivor, and Hemi Charger are featured.

episodes.name: Elephant In A '69
episodes.overview: The Graveyard Ghouls return to a brand new season of Graveyard Carz the show wherein abandoned and left for death classic Mopars are given a new lease on life. In this episode, theMopar Morticians work on the ultra rare 1969 Hemi Road Runner.

episodes.name: From Road Runner To Superbird
episodes.overview: The Ghouls are commissioned to transform a '70 Plymouth Road Runner and convert it into a Superbird Tribute with the use of Coronet fenders, an aerodynamic nosecone, flushmount headlights and backlight, and the NASCAR inspired adjustable rear-wing.

episodes.name: Roaming the Restorations
episodes.overview: Mark begins installing decals on World Heavyweight Champion, Bill Goldberg's 1968 GTX Convertible. Allysa works her way around the shop helping Will block and prep the Phantom Cuda for final paint and assisting Dave with the Road Runnerand bumper install.

episodes.name: Taming a 1971 Challenger R/T
episodes.overview: After a performing poorly, the Graveyard Ghouls are tasked with disassembling and assessingthe damage to a 383 engine for a customer's 1971 Challenger currently in the shop.

episodes.name: Privilege to Drive a '68 GTX Concertible
episodes.overview: Mark and Royal set out to pick up an old familiar Dodge Power Wagon that uncovers a lot of old memories while Dave and Allysa get ready to build out the center console for the 1967 HemiGTX Convertible.

episodes.name: Mark Unwrapped
episodes.overview: Will tries to prep and prime, the 1970 Cuda, 440 six-barrel despite Mark micromanaging his every task. The convertible top installation for the sixty-seven, Hemi GTX, is underway. But will some last minute changes halt the progress?

episodes.name: Dude, Where's Alyssa's Car
episodes.overview: With actor, retired pro football player, and multi title World Wrestling Champion Bill "The Spear" Goldberg on his way to the shop, the ghouls have very little time to complete the last minute details on his 1968 Plymouth GTX convertible.

episodes.name: A Fly In The Ointment
episodes.overview: Will begins cutting and buffing the fabled Phantom Cuda, but numerous interruptions from the eagerly helpful Allysa, make him decide a bit of friendly hazing is in order. Dave begins working on his own restoration, a 1970 Dodge swinger three-forty engine.

episodes.name: Will Gets Grumpy
episodes.overview: Allysa and Mark apply decals to the Hemi Roadrunner, convertible. Will decides to take a light work day; after he paints the jams on the Superbird tribute car, he takes off to the tattoo shop to get a very apt character permanently affixed to to his arm.

episodes.name: Phantom's 440 Six Barrel
episodes.overview: Painted and built to perfection, the heart of the legendary '71 'Cuda is ready to be installed. Mark teaches Adam how to build out the front suspension and assembles the rear-axle.

episodes.name: Cap'ing-off The Challenger
episodes.overview: Will jams and preps the Green Go Challenger for its final paint while Allysa and Mark assess a newly arrived 1968 Dodge Charger. Tired of Mark's antics in the paint booth, Will decides to take matters into his own hands.

episodes.name: 67 Hemi GTX Convertible Resurrected
episodes.overview: After commissioning Graveyard Carz to repair botched restoration work, Mopar collector Bret Torino's 1967 Hemi GTX Convertible is nearly ready for its grand reveal.

episodes.name: 72 Charger SE Resurrected
episodes.overview: Dave and Allysa tackle the interior for the custom '72 Charger SE, as the owner plans on taking it for it's very first test-drive at the end of the week.

episodes.name: Grin and Bear a 'Cuda
episodes.overview: The guys get cracking on the infamous '71 Phantom Cuda, installing the exhaust, door windows, tail lights, rear valance, body plugs and gills.

episodes.name: General Lee Considered
episodes.overview: Will and Dave team up to get the 1971 Phantom Cuda's grill painted and built out; Allysa gets trained on the Stringo; and Mark and Will get historical in their pursuit of the perfect paint for the famous 1969 Charger General Lee.

episodes.name: Operation Firepower
episodes.overview: Mark and Royal go off-road and down memory lane when they fire up their friend's old Dodge truck; Mark announces a top secret project to the crew; and Allysa surprises her dad for Father's Day.

episodes.name: The Roadrunner Gives Me a Hemi
episodes.overview: The only 1969 Hemi Roadrunner Convertible is back on the lift. With the owner soon to arrive, the crew have to ramp up and get it finished.

episodes.name: Judgement Day
episodes.overview: Tony and Cindy D'Agostino visit the Ghouls in the Graveyard; Mark and Tony geek out over several cemetery selects, including the 1970 Superbee 383 Magnum, the 1971 Plymouth Roadrunner.

episodes.name: Cuda 'Tat
episodes.overview: Will's successful application of FK5 paint on a 1970 Burnt Orange 'Cuda places him under Mark and Alltya's scrutiny when he has to repeat the perfect paint job.

episodes.name: What We Do for a Buck
episodes.overview: Buck's 1971 Dodge Challenger R/T is restored.

episodes.name: Grin and Bear a 'Cuda
episodes.overview: Will and Dave paint and build out the 1971 Phantom 'Cuda's grill; Allysa trains on a vehicle mover; Mark and Will search for the perfect paint for the famous 1969 Charger General Lee.

episodes.name: General Lee Considered
episodes.overview: Mark and Royal go off-road and down memory lane when they fire up their friend's old Dodge truck; Mark announces a top secret project to the crew; and Allysa surprises her dad for Father's Day.

episodes.name: Operation Firepower
episodes.overview: The 1-of-1 ever built, 1969 Hemi Road Runner convertible returns to the lift; the ghouls scramble to finish work on the vehicle before the owner arrives.

episodes.name: The Roadrunner Gives Me a Hemi
episodes.overview: Tony and Cindy D'Agostino visit the Ghouls in the Graveyard; Mark and Tony geek out over several cemetery selects, including the 1970 Superbee 383 Magnum, the 1971 Plymouth Roadrunner.

episodes.name: Judgement Day
episodes.overview: The ghouls install the exhaust, door windows, taillights, rear valance, body plugs and gills on the infamous '71 Phantom Cuda.

episodes.name: Cuda 'Tat
episodes.overview: Ever since Will laid out a perfect paint job on the 1970 Burnt Orange 'Cuda,with the very difficult to apply FK5 paint, he has feared this day. Under Mark and Alyssa's scrutiny he has to repeat the perfect paint job or suffer the consequences.

episodes.name: What We Do for a Buck
episodes.overview: Buck's 1971 Dodge Challenger R/T is restored.

episodes.name: Daytona vs. Hellcat
episodes.overview: The top-secret Firepower 'Cuda returns from the dipper; Allyssa is trained to be a killing machine; George, Ryan and Josh begin body work on the '69 Charger General Lee.

episodes.name: Firepower Un-Boxed
episodes.overview: Mark finally reveals, to the ghouls, what the "Operation Firepwer" project is all about.

episodes.name: Mopar or No Car
episodes.overview: Ron Jenkins from Magnum Force and his buddy Jeff help out with the Firepower 'Cuda; MOPAR Chief Operating Officer of Components (COOC), Pietro Gorler makes a surprise visit to the shop.

episodes.name: Firepower Operation
episodes.overview: With SEMA around the corner, the Ghouls work hard to complete Operation Firepower. Magn Force bring the Operation Firepower headers and exhaust system.

episodes.name: Disneyland of Carz
episodes.overview: The Ghouls continue preparations for SEMA; Allysa makes her move to get revenge on Will when the Firepower 'Cuda is readyt for the big reveal in Las Vegas, NV.

episodes.name: The Phantom 'Cuda Rides Again
episodes.overview: One of the longest restorations in Graveyard's history, the 1971 440 six-barrel Phantom 'Cuda, is revealed to its owner.

7.name: Season 7
7.overview: "Graveyard Carz" is a new genre of reality show. It fuses cars, characters, and comedy into a program unlike any other. "Graveyard Carz" is an automotive reality show focusing on restoring Chrysler muscle cars. Not only are the cars wrecked, they are beyond repair. To fix a Graveyard Car, it can't just be restored, it has to be resurrected.

episodes.name: General Assemble Lee
episodes.overview: In the Season 8 premiere, the Ghouls return with the final assembly of the legendary General Lee, which so happens to also be the official screen-used, record-holding, freeway jump-car from the 2005 "Dukes of Hazzard" film.

episodes.name: Put Up Your Dukes
episodes.overview: Mark begins the assembly of the 440 4BBL for the 1970 Plum Crazy Challenger, previously owned by a former cast member.

episodes.name: General Deliver Lee
episodes.overview: It is a delivery day at the Graveyard. The team reviews every moment in the restoration of the notable, screen-used, and record-holding General Lee from the 2005 “Dukes of Hazzard" film.

episodes.name: Dueling Drivetrains
episodes.overview: With Mark out of the shop looking at a potential new location for a Mopar car-dealership, the Graveyard Ghouls begin the drivetrain assembly's for a 1970 Lime Light Tribute Superbird and the 1970 Plum Crazy Challenger.

episodes.name: Getting Schooled
episodes.overview: Mark and the Ghouls race against the clock to finish some last-minute tasks on their various Mopar restorations before traveling north to judge a car show at Little Creek Casino.

episodes.name: Roadrunner With a Twist
episodes.overview: Mark and Allysa install the graphics on the '71 Plumb Crazy Challenger; the 1970 Lemon-Twist Roadrunner gets finished and readied for delivery to it's owner; Mark proposes what he thinks is a brilliant idea to the show's producers.

episodes.name: Engines, Assemblies, and Dougie, Oh My!
episodes.overview: With the 1970 Plum Crazy Challenger nearing completion, works shifts to the 1970 Tribute Superbird; Mark and Cousin Dougie build out a 340 engine; Will assists George with metal work to help him stay on schedule.

episodes.name: I Love the Smell of Plum Crazy in the Morning
episodes.overview: It's a special day at Graveyard Carz. The 1970 Plum Crazy Challenger that has been part of the show since the beginning, is finally finished and ready to be shipped to it's new owner. But before they do that, they take it to the coast to show it off.

episodes.name: Gone in 60 Days
episodes.overview: Work ramps up on our 1970 Tribute Superbird and just when things couldn't get more stressful, Mark has taken on a new project - a 1968 GTX owned by none other than Chris Jacobs, host of Overhaulin'.

episodes.name: Mopardy
episodes.overview: Stress levels rise in the shop when Mark learns that the owner of Tony’s Mopar Parts will be arriving to check on the progress of his 1970 Dodge Challenger; Mark distracts Tony while the team hustles to begin the vehicle’s restoration.

episodes.name: A Buck Shorted
episodes.overview: SEMA 2017 is fast approaching and the Graveyard Ghouls are working hard on Chris Jacob's 1969 GTX and John Buck's 1971 Challenger with a Hellcrate Hemi. But as pressure begins to mount, Mark questions if he'll be able to keep his promises.

episodes.name: The Phoenix 'Cuda
episodes.overview: A look at the Phoenix Cuda which is reborn after being incinerated to ashes.

episodes.name: Sema Has Eyes On A Hellbird

8.name: Season 8
8.overview: Graveyard Carz is an American automotive reality TV show that restores late 1960s / early 1970s Mopar muscle cars

episodes.name: Sema Has Eyes On A Hellbird
episodes.overview: Graveyard Carz returns to conclude the epic builds of Chris Jacob's 1968 GTX after it suffered a devastating fire, and a 1970 Plymouth Superbird equipped with a Hellcat Crate Hemi.

episodes.name: 68 Gtx Vs. Echo Bomber
episodes.overview: New Season, New Carz! With SEMA in their rear-view mirror, the ghouls begin the final assembly of a 1969 Plymouth GTX in Seafoam Turquoise. And when help comes up short-handed, Mark enlists what he likes to call his "Echo Bomber."

episodes.name: Pilot Takes Flight
episodes.overview: It's the 100th Episode! Join Mark and Royal and watch the never-before-aired Pilot featuring some of the first Mopar restorations the original ghouls tackled over ten-years ago.

episodes.name: Surveying The Will To Work
episodes.overview: It's a hectic day. Dave jumps from car to car, installing and assembling what he can; Will struggles to keep focused on one project at a time; and Mark makes progress on his A100 build with the hopes of revealing at SEMA 2018.

episodes.name: What's Next?
episodes.overview: Professional wrestler, actor, and former pro football player known for his time in the WWE and WCW as Goldberg returns to the Graveyard! This time, he brings the ghouls two brand new projects - one of which includes installing a brand-new cars.

episodes.name: Performance With A Touch Of Luxury
episodes.overview: The Ghouls say goodbye to the 1970 Superbird by taking it for one last drive.

episodes.name: Dissecting A Daytona
episodes.overview: With a Plymouth GTX finished, the ghouls refocus their efforts on the 1970 Dodge Daytona; Mark and Tony had debated whether they should restore it or not; with the owner wanting a full restoration, the Ghouls begin the tedious disassembly.

episodes.name: Exorcize A Demon
episodes.overview: The crew begins the restoration on one of the most requested renovations ever: a 1971 Dodge Demon.

episodes.name: Frankenstein's Work
episodes.overview: It's crunch time at Graveyard Carz; Mark continues to work on his A100 build for SEMA; Will struggles to keep the momentum up in the paint department; Dave continues to assemble an extremely rare and valuable Coronet Convertible.

episodes.name: Look to the West for B5 Blue
episodes.overview: Dave is ready to wrap up the 1970 Challenger RT/SE but is waiting for parts; Mark's A100 build continues; after a long and tedious bodywork and paint phase, Will is ready to deliver Dave the 1969 B5 Blue Plymouth GTX.

episodes.name: A Challenger Reflected
episodes.overview: The Ghouls finish the 1970 Challenger RT/SE; as they take it out for its first test drive in more than 15 years, Mark and the team reflect on the trials and challenges throughout the restoration process.

episodes.name: Mark, Dougie, Allysa, Oh My!
episodes.overview: Things kick into high-gear around the shop; the team begins the restoration of a Challenger T/A; Will paints a '68 GTX in B7 Blue; Allysa learns dash assembly; they install the drivetrain for the ultra-rare 1970 Hemi Convertible Coronet R/T.

episodes.name: Shaking The Magic 8-ball
episodes.overview: Mark pulls back the curtain on the next four Mopars in desperate need of resurrection while also showcasing the fans favorite moments from Seasons 8 and 9.

episodes.name: Ripping Up the Dash
episodes.overview: Mark and the Ghouls are back, and with a call in from the owner of the super-rare 1 of 2 ever made, 1970 Coronet Hemi Convertible, Mark has to work fast to reach a looming deadline. At the same time, Will primes the body of our 1969 Daytona.

episodes.name: Everybody Loves Raymond
episodes.overview: While Mark is out testing the completed 1968 Charger, the owner shows up for a surprise visit! While the owner waits, Will finishes the paint job on a beautiful 1970 Challenger in B5 Blue.

episodes.name: Upshift Creek
episodes.overview: Mark has been invited to a massive car show at the Little Creek Casino but before he can go, Mark and Doug need to disassemble the Phoenix 'Cuda: a car that survived a garage fire; Allysa and Will meet the fans and find their pick of the show.

episodes.name: It's A Duster Buster
episodes.overview: Mark teaches Allysa the finer points of installing a grill and headlights on her 1972 Duster; George attacks a tricky quarter panel to a 1969 'Cuda.

episodes.name: Carbituary: Charger
episodes.overview: In a special episode, Mark shows unique differences, surprising insights and cool features on multiple years of the same car: the Dodge Charger.

episodes.name: 1.5 Million Dollar Baby
episodes.overview: The crew installs the grill, bumper, dash and interior of the '68 Turbine Bronze Charger; when a familiar face shows up, the crew shifts their focus to a super rare '70 Coronet and finishes the interior.

episodes.name: Willie, Paint it Black?
episodes.overview: With SEMA 2018 looming on the horizon, it's time to address the elephant in the room: Mark's 1964 A100 Hemi truck; The Little Dead Wagon, built as an homage to Bill Maverick's Little Red Wagon, gets new paint and a super powerful engine.

episodes.name: The A100 Team
episodes.overview: Mark and the Ghouls get down to work like never before in order to get the A100 ready for SEMA, which is only weeks away; the Mopar Maniacs race to get brakes, suspension, bed sealer, tail lights and more done in time.

episodes.name: Night of the Little Dead Wagon
episodes.overview: SEMA is almost here but the iconic A100 still needs some buttoning up; installing all of the final components means it's all-hands-on-deck; the team heads to SEMA to roll the Little Dead Wagon over the red carpet for Mopar.

episodes.name: Carbiturary: Cuda
episodes.overview: When Mark gets started talking about a car, there is almost no stopping him. In this episode, Mark shares multiple years of his favorite Mopar builds--detailing the amazing options and the cool differences. The team joins in the fun.

episodes.name: Duster In The Wind
episodes.overview: Progress never stops at Graveyard Carz. SEMA is over the Ghouls can finally get back to work on all the cars they had to leave untouched for the last few weeks. First up is a beautiful 1972 Duster

episodes.name: The Last WS27R on Earth
episodes.overview: Brett Torino is coming to claim his legendary 1970 Coronet (1 of 2 ever made) from its long awaited restoration with the Mopar Master and Mark's got a few tricks up his sleeve; the epic reveal, like this vehicle, is absolutely one of a kind.

episodes.name: Taking Home the Bronze
episodes.overview: See the beautiful Turbine-Bonze Metallic 1968 Charger meticulously resurrected and revealed to its proud owner.

episodes.name: Rallye the Troops
episodes.overview: Mark leaves Will in charge of the shop while working on his super-secret SEMA 2019 build; George and Dougie to begin the final assembly to the 1970 B7 Challenger while contending with Will; a 1970 'Cuda is prepped for its first-coat of Rallye Red.

episodes.name: This Is Boring
episodes.overview: Mark takes a road-trip to Boring, Ore., to look at a new restoration project; when it turns out to be an unusually well-preserved muscle-car, Mark must work outside his comfort zone to try to wheel and deal.

episodes.name: Allysa's Billboard Hit
episodes.overview: Allysa and Dougie finish building out the 440 engine for the 1968 GTX currently in assembly; Allysa and Mark begin one of the most difficult decal applications, a White Billboard for the 1970 'Cuda Convertible.

episodes.name: Raise the Roof
episodes.overview: Dougie does a deep dive when he completely builds out the rear end assembly for the 1969 GTX; Mark and George break out the hydraulics to reverse the damage done to Mark's newest acquisition; a Graveyard favorite returns.

episodes.name: Hellafury
episodes.overview: The Graveyard is covered in an unexpected blanket of snow, prompting Mark to install its first mausoleum; the ghouls focus on a 1969 GTX, installing ornamentation and chrome; Mark takes over the airwaves to announce what he's building for SEMA.

episodes.name: To Beep, or Not to Beep
episodes.overview: While the ghouls finish up the ornamentation and chrome moldings for the 1969 GTX, Cousin Dougie enlists the Greenhorn's help to disassemble the first 1970 Road Runner - with careful precision to hopefully find the car's broadcast sheet.

episodes.name: Amentini, Shaken Not Stirred
episodes.overview: The 1970 Challenger in B7 Blue owned by the Amentinis is finished and ready to be revealed; witnessing every moment of its restoration, from dead to resurrected and detailed to the way it left the factory floor.

episodes.name: Dougon'it
episodes.overview: Whether it's building an engine, restoring parts, or hiding mannequins, Cousin Dougie is on it; he's one of the most pivotal Ghouls, working on a vast number of Mopar restoration projects or tasks that are essential to the success of the shop.

episodes.name: Baptism by Fire
episodes.overview: The Phoenix 'Cuda, the car that survived a deadly explosion, is ready for its purification; its rust and metal are seared away to expose its hidden sins; thus begins the first stage of its monumental rebirth.

episodes.name: Parking In-Violetion
episodes.overview: The ghouls shift into high gear to make progress on the In-Violet 1971 'Cuda convertible; work begins on the SEMA 2019 build.

episodes.name: The Reel Life of GYC
episodes.overview: Since 2012, the show has become synonymous with high-quality Mopar restoration and continues to grow with new builds and fans each year; pulling back the curtain to reveal the cast and crew's favorite moments and what they hope to build next.

10.name: Season 10
10.overview: "Graveyard Carz" is a new genre of reality show. It fuses cars, characters, and comedy into a program unlike any other. "Graveyard Carz" is an automotive reality show focusing on restoring Chrysler muscle cars. Not only are the cars wrecked, they are beyond repair. To fix a Graveyard Car, it can't just be restored, it has to be resurrected.

episodes.name: Gimme The Green-Light
episodes.overview: The crew begins door and panel alignment on a '69 Charger, and finds some surprises while disassembling Christine. When a rare Hemi Coronet returns, Mark realizes he's spread too thin to catch important quality-control issues.

episodes.name: Take it to the Limit
episodes.overview: While the crew works on final assembly for a problematic '69 GTX, Allysa discovers they face major fines following an OSHA inspection. The network rejects a scene and forces Mark to review comedy routines he's done in the past.

episodes.name: For the Love of Money
episodes.overview: The crew mocks up Christine's engine over the frame, and Will preps and paints a 1966 Charger. When an important piece of equipment breaks down, Allysa has to figure out what happened and get it fixed.

episodes.name: Whole Lotta Love
episodes.overview: The crew focuses on a '71 In-Violet 'Cuda convertible, while Will primes Tony D'Agostino's '70 Plum Crazy Challenger. Mark ignores his birthday, and realizes that a car lined up for restoration may not be worth the effort.

episodes.name: It Don't Come Easy
episodes.overview: The Ghouls continue to work on the '71 In-Violet 'Cuda convertible, while Christine's metalwork begins. When Tony shows up unexpectedly, Mark dodges his questions about the status of his car.

episodes.name: You Can't Always Get What You Want
episodes.overview: The ghouls shift gears to work on a 1970 Rallye Red 'Cuda, while Mark and Tony assess a 1964 Plymouth Fury. The crew is forced to make some tough choices between doing what's right for the show and keeping Mark happy.

episodes.name: You're the One I Want
episodes.overview: The crew returns to form to continue the assembly on a beautiful In-Violet 1971 'Cuda convertible, Christine's frame is refitted, and the disassembly of a 225 slant-six sets the stage for a bet between Mark and Doug.

episodes.name: Only the Strong Survive
episodes.overview: Mark redirects the crew to focus their efforts on a 1969 Superbee. The owner has been patient, but is eagerly awaiting delivery, and Mark doesn't want Christine or any other project to delay this classic muscle car build.

episodes.name: A Long and Winding Road
episodes.overview: With final assembly finished, the 1970 Rallye Red 'Cuda is primed to be fired up and driven. Before it takes its maiden voyage, the crew takes a look back at what it took to restore this car and convert it from a 318 to a 440.

episodes.name: Just The Way You Are
episodes.overview: One of eight ever made, the 1971 In Violet Plymouth 'Cuda 383 is finished and ready for delivery. Before the final touches, the crew reflects on the journey the car has taken and share unseen footage of the build.

episodes.name: Bad to the Bone
episodes.overview: In a build too big for just one episode, the tribute 1958 Plymouth Fury, famously known as Christine, not only gets a full restoration with OE attention to detail, but gets a brand-new modern third-generation 426 Hemi.

episodes.name: Beast of Burden
episodes.overview: With the SEMA Show 2019 just days away, the team scrambles to finish the assembly of the tribute "Christine." Mark begins to question how complete the car will be when it ships to the convention center in Las Vegas, Nevada.

episodes.name: We Belong Together
episodes.overview: The destination is SEMA Show 2019 in Las Vegas, Nevada. As the ghouls visit with fans, they reflect on their accomplishments and failures and look ahead at the exciting upcoming restorations for the new year.

11.name: Season 11
11.overview: "Graveyard Carz" is a new genre of reality show. It fuses cars, characters, and comedy into a program unlike any other. "Graveyard Carz" is an automotive reality show focusing on restoring Chrysler muscle cars. Not only are the cars wrecked, they are beyond repair. To fix a Graveyard Car, it can't just be restored, it has to be resurrected.

episodes.name: There Will Be 'Cudas
episodes.overview: It's an episode of E-Bodies, including disassembly, documentation and suspicion that one of the newly arrived 'Cudas may have forged numbers.

episodes.name: Full Metal Phoenix
episodes.overview: A pragmatic Mark Worman observes the metal restoration of the 1971 Phoenix 'Cuda. It's a painstaking task to undo the damage caused by the brutal fire in which it died.

episodes.name: The Big Cheesesteak
episodes.overview: Tony "Cheesesteak" D'Agostino, the true Mopar guru, seeks updates on his wife's Plum Crazy Challenger and enlists his buddy Will to help get them.

episodes.name: Perks of Being a Challenger
episodes.overview: The Ghouls give their care and attention to a Dodge Challenger, and welcome it to the next phase of its restoration

episodes.name: The Road Runner Diaries - Part 1
episodes.overview: The Ghouls begin the 45-day restoration of a 1970 Road Runner. It's owned by tool creator Mark Martinez, who drove the car in his youth and believes it showed him his life's calling.

episodes.name: The Road Runner Diaries - Part 2
episodes.overview: The Ghouls attempt to finish the 45-day restoration of a 1970 Road Runner, owned by tool creator Mark Martinez, who can't wait to take it for its first drive.

episodes.name: The Fast and Furry-ous
episodes.overview: Mark must decide where his loyalty really lies when he becomes enamored with the Road Runners he has previously restored.

episodes.name: Frankenstein's '71 Cuda
episodes.overview: Mark and George bust out the welders and rebuild the body for the deadest 1971 'Cuda they've ever encountered in the history of GYC.

episodes.name: The Usual GTXs
episodes.overview: The finishing of a 1969 GTX sparks the tale of its shaky restoration leading up to its delivery. This is only the latest of five previously-restored GTXs that the crew has brought back from the dead.

episodes.name: No Country For Old Chargers
episodes.overview: Nostalgic reminiscing ensues after Mark stumbles upon information about his childhood Charger while archiving files from past restorations.

episodes.name: The Dayton's Advocate
episodes.overview: An exceptionally-kept survivor Daytona is finally getting the attention it deserves during assembly -- the last phase of its restoration.

episodes.name: Greetings From SEMA
episodes.overview: The crew looks back at their biggest SEMA builds, and offers a sneak peek at what's to come.

12.name: Graveyard Carz
12.overview: "Graveyard Carz" is a new genre of reality show. It fuses cars, characters, and comedy into a program unlike any other. "Graveyard Carz" is an automotive reality show focusing on restoring Chrysler muscle cars. Not only are the cars wrecked, they are beyond repair. To fix a Graveyard Car, it can't just be restored, it has to be resurrected.

episodes.name: There Will Be 'Cudas
episodes.overview: Spotlighting E-Bodies, including disassembly, documentation and suspicion that one of the newly arrived 'Cudas may have forged numbers.

episodes.name: Full Metal Phoenix
episodes.overview: A pragmatic Mark Worman observes the metal restoration of the 1971 Phoenix 'Cuda. It's a painstaking task to undo the damage caused by the brutal fire in which it died.

episodes.name: The Big Cheesesteak
episodes.overview: The true Mopar guru, Tony Cheesesteak D'Agostino, seeks updates on his wife's Plum Crazy Challenger and enlists Will to help get them.

episodes.name: Perks of Being a Challenger
episodes.overview: Giving care and attention to a Dodge Challenger, and taking it to the next phase of its restoration.

episodes.name: The Road Runner Diaries- Part 1
episodes.overview: The Ghouls begin the 45-day restoration of a 1970 Road Runner. It's owned by tool creator Mark Martinez, who drove the car in his youth and believes it showed him his life's calling.

episodes.name: The Road Runner Diaries- Part 2
episodes.overview: The Ghouls attempt to finish the 45-day restoration of a 1970 Road Runner owned by tool creator Mark Martinez, who can't wait to take it for its first drive.

episodes.name: The Fast and Furry-ous
episodes.overview: Mark becomes enamored with Road Runners he had previously restored.

episodes.name: Frankenstein's '71 'Cuda
episodes.overview: The guys rebuild the body for the deadest 1971 'Cuda they've ever seen.

episodes.name: The Usual GTX's
episodes.overview: The finishing of a 1969 GTX sparks the tale of its shaky restoration leading up to its delivery; this is only the latest of five previously-restored GTXs that the crew has brought back from the dead.

episodes.name: The Charger Syndrome
episodes.overview: While researching early Mopars, Allysa discovers what is so appealing about the 1966 model year for die-hard Charger enthusiasts.

episodes.name: No Country for Old Charger
episodes.overview: Mark reminisces about his childhood Charger while archiving files.

episodes.name: The Daytona's Advocate
episodes.overview: An exceptionally-kept survivor Daytona is finally getting the attention it deserves during assembly.

episodes.name: Greetings from SEMA
episodes.overview: The crew looks back at their biggest SEMA builds, and offers a sneak peek at what's to come.

13.name: Season 13
13.overview: "Graveyard Carz" is a new genre of reality show. It fuses cars, characters, and comedy into a program unlike any other. "Graveyard Carz" is an automotive reality show focusing on restoring Chrysler muscle cars. Not only are the cars wrecked, they are beyond repair. To fix a Graveyard Car, it can't just be restored, it has to be resurrected.

episodes.name: Previous Sins
episodes.overview: Mark and Allysa validate Goldberg's 1970 V-Code 'Cuda; Will paints the Daytona nose cone; Doug teams up with Royal to complete the rear axle assembly for a 1969 Charger R/T.

episodes.name: The Numbers Don't Lie
episodes.overview: Mark and the Ghoulz are resurrecting Mopar muscle cars to look exactly like they did when they rolled off the assembly line.

episodes.name: Road Runner (Almost) a GO GO
episodes.overview: A father and son share their memories of a beloved 1968 Road Runner; Mark and Doug test fire the 383 engine; Mark teams up with Justin to apply a Daytona decal; Mark and the Ghouls test fire the engine in the 1970 'Cuda.

episodes.name: Every Time a Bell Rings a Daytona Gets Its Wing
episodes.overview: Mark, Royal and Doug install a numbers-matching 440 in a 1969 Charger R/T SE; Will paints a 1969 'Cuda 383 in B5 Blue; Justin and Mark install the wing on the 1969 Daytona; Mark takes the 1970 Sublime 'Cuda out for a road test.

episodes.name: B5 Jambin' with Will
episodes.overview: Royal and Justin install an exhaust on the 1969 Daytona; Mark accuses Royal of ratting him out to the cops half a century ago; Will primes the 1970 Demon; Mark and Doug head out to purchase a 1969 Charger R/T 440 4-speed Track Pack.

episodes.name: A Cuda in the Limelight!
episodes.overview: The numbers-matching 383 goes into the '68 Road Runner; Will primes the '70 Moulin Rouge 'Cuda; Mark and Justin install the dash in the '69 Daytona; the '70 Limelight 'Cuda is revealed to its owners.

episodes.name: The Gouls Get Nosey
episodes.overview: Installing the 383 Super Commando in the 1969 'Cuda; Mark recounts a harrowing marshmallow story involving Cousin Dougie; the Daytona nose cone is built and Mark teams up with the crew to install it.

episodes.name: No One... Hides Cars Like Gaston
episodes.overview: Mark and Doug travel to Oregon for a 1969 T5 Copper Charger R/T; Will paints a 1970 'Cuda FM3 Moulin Rouge; Mark and Doug assemble the Charger for transport; Will paints a 1958 engine in a rarely seen gold.

episodes.name: What's Past is Prologue
episodes.overview: In preparation for delivery to its new owner in Switzerland, the legendary Phantom Cuda returns to the shop for modifications, prompting Mark and the Ghouls to revisit the car.

episodes.name: The Heart of the Phoenix
episodes.overview: Will prepares the Phoenix 'Cuda for final paint in GB5 Blue; Mark and Dougie test-fire a 426 Hemi; the 1968 Road Runner gets its headliner installed.

episodes.name: A Very Special Delivery
episodes.overview: The crew takes a detailed look at the multi-stage resurrection of a very rare 1969 B5 Blue GTX; Mark and Dougie deliver the GTX to its owners.

episodes.name: Jack is Back on the Road
episodes.overview: Jack Curtis' 1968 Road Runner is completed. Join the Curtis family and their friends, as they react to the arrival, and welcome home their long-awaited family car.

episodes.name: Documentary Evidence
episodes.overview: Mark examines the most documented car in the history of Graveyard Carz. Mark has all the evidence needed to bring this one owner, 1968 GTX, back to its former glory. But is Mark not the "O.E.M." man he used to be?

episodes.name: Real Cars Wear Pink
episodes.overview: Known as Moulin Rouge and Panther Pink, FM3 is a 1970-only color. Three real FM3 pink Mopars are featured: A Super Bee from the first episode, a very rare Challenger, and the restoration of a unique 1970 'Cuda in perfect Moulin Rouge.

episodes.name: Mark G. Worman, "G" is for Guru
episodes.overview: Mark shows how the corpse of a decaying Dodge will save a customer's cherished Charger. Will and Noah primer and paint a 1970 Road Runner convertible, prompting Mark and Will to discuss the finer points of painting pedagogy.

episodes.name: Charge Back to the Future
episodes.overview: Will makes his first attempt to paint a Hemi Charger in a very rare, 1966-only color, ZZ1 Gold Poly. Meanwhile, the guys restore a 1968 Charger, bringing a rusted wreck back to life with otherwise-unattainable parts from a donor Dodge.

episodes.name: Grin like a Cheshire 'Cuda
episodes.overview: Mark and Cousin Dougie retrieve a 1970 Barracuda, while Will paints a Road Runner's hood treatment. Tony D'Agostino visits the shop to check on his wife's newly restored 1970 Challenger R/T, but where's Mark?

episodes.name: Plum Crazy Wife
episodes.overview: Cindy D'Agostino's 1970 Challenger R/T, 440, FC7 Plum Crazy, is finally revealed. We all know how crazy Tony D can get when it comes to detailed restorations, but how will his wife react to her newest purple Challenger?

episodes.name: Top Paint Gun
episodes.overview: The guys begin the final assembly of an all numbers matching, 1969 Charger R/T SE, 440 Magnum, 4-Speed. Mark challenges Will to yet another, mano-a-mano paint-off. Who will win?

episodes.name: Will Interrupted
episodes.overview: Doug disassembles and dissects parts from a 70 Challenger that can't be restored. They resurrect memories by creating a tribute 1971 Challenger R/T, 440 Six Pack, in Hemi Orange. All while, Will is ready to spray his custom EV2 formula.

episodes.name: A Tale of Two Chargers
episodes.overview: Justin completes the interior of a '69 Charger R/T SE. Mark and Doug build out a '66, ZZ1 Gold Poly, Hemi engine, connected to a 4-speed manual transmission. This is Doug's first Hemi install in a '66 Charger is bound to be memorable.

episodes.name: Mark and Tony Challenge a Demon
episodes.overview: Will gets a new helper in the paint booth, but will he drive Will crazy. Mark and Tony dissect a Dodge Demon that could be only one of one ever made. The guys evaluate a 1970 Challenger R/T, 440 6 Pack, 4-speed, convertible.

episodes.name: A Phantastic Halloween!
episodes.overview: A phantasm from Mark's past reaches out from the grave. There is no better holiday to celebrate at the Graveyard than Halloween. This year's "celebration" may have the crew reaching for a stake and a hammer.

episodes.name: The Gold Key to the Crapper
episodes.overview: The Ghoulz lay out and buff the paint job on Christine, and tease the rebirth of this movie-correct car. Justin forges ahead with the final assembly of the 1970 Tor Red roadrunner convertible while Mark demonstrates an Air Grabber hood.

episodes.name: The Road Running Home
episodes.overview: Mark gets good news that Allysa is pregnant and Mark will have a grandson; he also gets bad news that one of his clients is in the hospital and doesn't have long, so the crew bands together to finish the client's 1971 Road Runner.

episodes.name: Flight of the Super Bee
episodes.overview: The crew races to finish a one-owner 1970 Super Bee that belongs to a decorated, retired Marine; as Mark and Justin forge ahead, a snafu on Will's side of the shop may cause a total mission failure.

episodes.name: Another Dreamz Machine
episodes.overview: Mark and Justin begin assembly on a rare 1971 Mr. Norm's Dodge Demon; the team shifts gears to focus on a 1969 Charger tribute car that's made to order.

episodes.name: Jonesing for a Road Runner
episodes.overview:
24 Dec 2022

New

When a local car dealer wants to bring back the car of his youth, he enlists Mark to create an identical twin to his 1969 Road Runner; this car will have one or two add-ons, including a sport hood treatment.

episodes.name: Memento Mori
episodes.overview: For the first time, the car is revealed backwards; beginning with the final product, the crew peels back the stages of the restoration; revealing what makes this 1971 Hemi Shaker Cuda special.

episodes.name: The 'Cuda Has a Challenger
episodes.overview: The Ghoulz head back to SEMA, but first they must finish the 1970 Dodge T/A Challenger tribute; the year's show features competition from one a restored Phoenix 'Cuda that was nearly incinerated in a fire.

episodes.name: Is That a Freckle?
episodes.overview: Still exhausted from SEMA in Las Vegas, Mark and the Ghoulz get back to the grind; Will prepares to paint his first 1970 AAR 'Cuda; with Mark breathing down his neck and micromanaging his methods, Will's rebellious nature is stirred up.

episodes.name: Episode 22
episodes.overview: When the local junkyard closes, Mark and Dougie have to rescue an old friend from the earliest days of Graveyard Carz.

episodes.name: I'm a Ragtop Man!
episodes.overview: Mark assists Justin in buttoning up the rear-end details of the 1970 roadrunner convertible. Justin gets to apply a full-length dust trail stripe and finish the roadrunner off with a detailed application of its factory (and some not so factory) assembly line-markings. Speaking of roadrunners, Will paints a super-rare, 1 of 137, 1971 roadrunner, 440 6-barrel, 4-speed. And Mark dives into a detailed detour of this rare bird's drivetrain. Finally, with a beak-to-tail inspection of the 1970 roadrunner complete, this car is green-lighted by Mark to hit the road.

episodes.name: Mark's Little Demon
episodes.overview: The famous 1971 Mr. Norm's Dodge Demon, 340 6-pack is cruising through the shop. While painting the engine and body of this incredibly rare car, Will takes the opportunity to train his son Brody. While Mark takes the opportunity to interrupt, "inspire", and indulge his favorite vice: vanity. Not content with only one good deed, he rescues a 340 engine build from his cousin Dougie, and engages in some conflict resolution between Dougie and Will. Stirring the pot and raising the question: How many demons can Graveyard Carz handle at one time?

episodes.name: A Hunk of Burning Love
episodes.overview: What do you get when you cross a bird with a fish? The one and only Phoenix 'Cuda. A tragic explosion and fire left this cherished car in the Graveyard. But now, under the care of Mark and the Ghoulz, it's blazing through the shop. This incredibly valuable, '71 Hemi 'Cuda is getting some detailed under-hood assembly. Mark and Justin go step by step through the procedures, parts, and protocols that make ultra-rare cars truly worth the effort, with OEM details only a "handful of people in the world" would know.

episodes.name: Tiny Dancer Strikes Again
episodes.overview: Mark illuminates the ultra-rare option of Mopar sunroofs, while the team tackles the task of restoring a real M51 power sunroof 1969 Charger R/T SE sunroof. Mark shows us what happened to the famous 1970 sunroof Challenger R/T from Graveyard Carz Season 4, and just how crazy the car market has become. Finally, with restrictions lifted, Mark prepares for the epic reveal of a one-of-one,1969 Charger R/T. That is until everything backfires and becomes the worst reveal in GYC history.

episodes.name: Tiny Dancer Strikes Again
episodes.overview: Mark illuminates the ultra-rare option of Mopar sunroofs, while the team tackles the task of restoring a real M51 power sunroof 1969 Charger R/T SE sunroof. Mark shows us what happened to the famous 1970 sunroof Challenger R/T from Graveyard Carz Season 4, and just how crazy the car market has become. Finally, with restrictions lifted, Mark prepares for the epic reveal of a one-of-one,1969 Charger R/T. That is until everything backfires and becomes the worst reveal in GYC history.

episodes.name: Yeah, it's Hopped Up to Over 160
episodes.overview: The 1970 Challenger, Vanishing Point tribute car is back. A major dream project for Mark is the creation of a series of Alpine White, 1970 Dodge Challenger R/T, tribute cars that are modeled after the iconic Mopar featured in the film "Vanishing Point". Gaining momentum in the shop, this will be the first Kowalski tribute he has ever produced. Seldom seen at the Graveyard, a 1973 Challenger Rallye 340 makes its way through the shop. Meanwhile, Mark passes the mantle of hosting his YouTube series, "Autopsy Report", to his daughter Allysa-whether she wants the job or not. But will he be able to pass on his "comedic genius"?

episodes.name: The Road Runner is In-Violet, Dougie is Plum Crazy
episodes.overview: Road Runners are overrunning the shop. Will continues to train his son Brody as the Graveyard's newest painter. But Mark can't seem to keep himself out of the paint booth, and out of Will's hair. Undaunted by Rocky impressions and saxophone solos, the father/son team layout FC7 In-Violet on a 1970 V-Code Road Runner, and the A4 Silver on a 1969 Road Runner, and apply the V21 Sport Hood Treatment. Meanwhile, Mark gathers evidence of Dougie's insanity while they install the drivetrain on the A4 Road Runner. Then without missing a beat, they grab the newest ghoul, Hunter (AKA Bubble Boy), to install another drivetrain in another Road Runner. Except for this time, it's 1970, In-Violet, 440 6 bbl, 4-speed. But with Hunter trying to earn a better moniker and Dougie being Dougie, Mark's sanity case may come to trial long before his cousin's.

episodes.name: Family Ties
episodes.overview: Two 1969 Hemi Charger R/T four-speed cars arrive at the shop. One still runs, so Mark and Doug go for a spin, prompting an animated retelling of Doug as a teenager. Back at the shop, Will continues to train his son, Brody, as they paint a 1970 'Cuda in F8 Ivy Green Poly.

episodes.name: A-Body in the Graveyard
episodes.overview: A stunning 1969 'Cuda has gone through metal, body, paint, and drivetrain installation, and it's in assembly for Justin and Allysa to apply the hood decals. The real Mr. Norm's '71 Demon is ready for Mark and Doug to install the drivetrain. Also, Tony D'Agostino is loitering around the shop, but at least he's bearing gifts.

episodes.name: Trey-Magnifique
episodes.overview: The 1971 Road Runner is in assembly, ready for its drive train. Mark and Doug check out a valuable 1969 Hemi Charger with walking Mopar encyclopedia Tony D'Agostino, and Allysa showcases a rare combination of features in a 1970 'Cuda. Plus, Mark introduces his newest innovation, the Trey-Cam.

episodes.name: 3 Amigos, 2 Road Runners, 1 Sunroof
episodes.overview: Three pilot pals want three custom-built Mopars, all done at the same time. Meanwhile, the '69 Road Runner is wheeling through assembly, and the one-of-one '70 Charger R/T factory-sunroof car is ready for some factory-duplicated welds.

episodes.name: The Ice-Trey
episodes.overview: To celebrate the show's 200th episode, Mark and the Ghoulz visit a private automotive museum. The crew also looks back at some of their favorite memories from the show.

episodes.name: Phoenix Rising
episodes.overview: Mark and the Ghoulz prepare to reveal the mythic Phoenix 'Cuda. This epic build will come to a close...if the restoration passes the owner's approval.

episodes.name: A Is for Mopar
episodes.overview: Two A-body beasts that coincidently arrived around the same time also happen to be getting done at the same time.

episodes.name: Boom Goes the Cam!
episodes.overview: This '69 Hemi Charger is a dream build, where the owner created a classic from the ground up.

episodes.name: Here's Mud in Your Eye
episodes.overview: A rarely seen numbers-matching '73 Challenger hits the road.

episodes.name: The Ghost and Mr. Rooster
episodes.overview: Mark and Cousin Dougie take a road trip to nearby Grants Pass, Oregon, to possibly purchase a '68 Charger.

episodes.name: Will Gets the Blues
episodes.overview: A mysterious Mopar makes its way through the metal shop.

episodes.name: R.I.P. Rust in Pieces
episodes.overview: Mark sells a car he swore he'd be buried in.

episodes.name: All the Road Runners
episodes.overview: With 10 Road Runners under Mark's belt, it's time for one more.

episodes.name: Million Dollar Mopar
episodes.overview: Back at the Brothers Car Collection, Tony and Mark go toe-to-toe over an orange '71 Hemi Challenger that may be the most optioned car of its kind.

episodes.name: The More Things Change
episodes.overview: Mark challenges his cousin Dougie to fire up a rusted-out old Super Bee from the graveyard.

episodes.name: Doug is Trippin'
episodes.overview: Mark and his cousin Dougie hit the road to find a hidden Mopar graveyard that's only an hour from the shop.

episodes.name: Breaking it Down
episodes.overview: Mark and Tony D'Agostino revisit the Brothers Car Collection in Salem, Oregon, to check out the legendary Rapid Transit Duster, once owned by Tony's best friend.

episodes.name: Lost Sox
episodes.overview: In this un-archived episode, that was nearly forgotten, Mark and Tony encounter a possible Sox & Martin racecar!

episodes.name: Graveyard Carz Next Generation
episodes.overview: Mark is forced outside of his comfort zone when Allysa returns to the show and wants a newer Challenger; as she conspires with Mark's connections for a great deal, Super-Trey begins to wonder what Allysa's real motives may be.

episodes.name: She Wore Orange Velvet
episodes.overview: Allysa continues her new pet project, a 2009 Dodge Challenger R/T, inspired with second-day add-ons of the past; Mark starts on his 1970 Dodge Charger tribute, recreating his first Mopar with aftermarket orange velvet seat inserts.

episodes.name: M-O-O-N Spells Orange
episodes.overview: A 1970 GTX 440 6-Barrel, in EK2 Vitamin C orange, is making headway through the paint shop.

episodes.name: Dirty Marty, Crazy Dougie
episodes.overview: After years of planning, Mark pulls back the curtain on his newest business venture, Graveyard Motorz.

episodes.name: I Thought This Was a Car Show
episodes.overview: Will's son Dylan is back in school, when Brian tutors him on interior assembly for a one-of-902 1970 'Cuda.

episodes.name: Boring Fractions
episodes.overview: Mark reveals what makes a numbers Hemi car correct.

episodes.name: Who's Uniside Are You Taking?
episodes.overview: This is the epic story of a 1971 Charger that arrived looking like a roll of Lifesavers! Mark shares the reason he should be awarded the Nobel Peace Prize. Mark and Shane attach a sort-of-original uniside. And Mark reveals his trick for selling unsellable cars.

episodes.name: Analyze This
episodes.overview: Brian and Mark dive into the assembly of a very rare 1969 Charger R/T Special Edition 440 4-speed.

episodes.name: Baking With Cousin Dougie!
episodes.overview: Dougie invades the paint shop to help Will by baking some valve covers in the kitchen.

episodes.name: Purple Haze
episodes.overview: Mark & Aaron recount a 1970 Road Runner that's reminiscent of the first car restored on the show.

episodes.name: The Phantom of Winchester
episodes.overview: Royal and Dougie build out a 426 Hemi for a 1969 Charger, and Mark entrusts Will with managing a collaboration that may be "The Phantom 'Cuda 2.0!".

episodes.name: J-E-F-F That Spells Geoff
episodes.overview: Mark reveals a game of fractional inches when a 1968 GTX has metal that misses the mark.

episodes.name: 1313 Mockingbird Lane
episodes.overview: Mark is sick of the Yamahauler! Can he get this problem-plagued build shaped up and shipped out?

episodes.name: The Dance
episodes.overview: Mark and Aaron reveal the Graveyard Carz restoration machine! Brody shows off his progress on a monochromatic 1970 'Cuda belonging to Slipknot guitarist Jim Root.

episodes.name: Heavy Metal
episodes.overview: It's heavy metal with Shane, Jason and Will as they mod a donor car to save a possibly one-of-one numbers-matching '70 GTX

episodes.name: Don't Be Goose!
episodes.overview: The pushrods have arrived and Mark teams up with his cousin to finish his engine build.

episodes.name: The Doug Days of Summer
episodes.overview: Doug disassembles the 440 Magnum from a '70 Charger that was in a wildfire.

episodes.name: Seal or No Seal
episodes.overview: Cousin Dougie gets the spotlight as he walks us through the full assembly of a 440 engine that was scorched in a wildfire; Dougie attempts to build an engine on his own.

episodes.name: Dougie's "Nasty" Habit
episodes.overview: Dougie tackles an impossible engine, a numbers-matching 440 Magnum from a 1968 Dodge Coronet R/T, that's been rusting for decades.

episodes.name: Jamaica Blues
episodes.overview: The Ghoulz complete and deliver a 1970 Dodge Charger R/T in Jamaica Blue.

episodes.name: Pitch and Complain
episodes.overview: Will mistakenly tells a customer his drivetrain is installed.

episodes.name: Baking with Cousin Dougie
episodes.overview: Dougie helps Will by baking some valve covers in the kitchen.

episodes.name: Mink 'Cuda
episodes.overview: Mark achieves all-new levels of Mopar nerdery when he scrutinizes a 1971 'Cuda with miraculously clean metal.

episodes.name: 250 and Counting
episodes.overview: Achieving their 250th episode, Mark and Aaron reflect on 20 seasons of Graveyard Carz, unearthing the elements that have kept the show on the air for over a decade.

episodes.name: The Birds
episodes.overview: Mark and Dougie hit the road to check out a mysterious 1969 Road Runner.

episodes.name: You Callin' Me Yella?
episodes.overview: Mark reveals what happened to the world's first production, Hellephant and its connection to an infamous Mopar movie car.

episodes.name: Mark Phones It In
episodes.overview: Bill Goldberg invades the Graveyard to strike a deal for a one-of-a-kind super car and he puts his daughter Allysa and his producer Aaron to the test with nothing more than a cell phone and his comedy.
